meanings.definition: The attribution of human characteristics to something nonhuman.
meanings.sent1: In the children's book, the talking animals exhibit prosopopoeia by showing human-like emotions.
meanings.sent2: The movie used prosopopoeia to give the robot a personality and make it relatable to the audience.
meanings.sent3: The prosopopoeia of the smiling sun in the cartoon made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting used prosopopoeia to make the mountains seem alive with human qualities.
meanings.sent5: The prosopopoeia of the old tree in the story made it feel like a wise character.

meanings.definition: A figure of speech in which an imaginary or absent person is represented as speaking or acting.
meanings.sent1: The author's use of prosopopoeia made the ghost in the story seem real and haunting.
meanings.sent2: During the play, the actor's prosopopoeia of a historical figure brought the past to life on stage.
meanings.sent3: The prosopopoeia of the missing sock in the laundry room made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her prosopopoeia of the wind as a mischievous child blowing leaves around was quite creative.
meanings.sent5: The prosopopoeia of the lonely house in the horror movie made it feel like a character in its own right.
